list_definition.definition: (extending over or found) everywhere in the world

list_ex_of_english: The estimates for actual losses due to pathogens, viruses, animal pests and weeds worldwide totalled 14, 7, 11 and 8 %, respectively.
It has been established for some 25 years, and operates worldwide.
There has been much discussion worldwide about the safest and most efficient ways of clearing landmines.
Probably, in species with a worldwide distribution, genetic changes may occur as populations adapt to new regions.
Work-related low back disorders are a significant and increasing problem worldwide.
Since the epidemiology of varicella varies worldwide, adopting foreign prevention policies may not always be applicable.
This was accompanied by a greater interaction worldwide between musicians from the 'free improv' and 'new music' scenes.
Organic farming worldwide 2007 overview and main statistics.
